title: Spicy Tuna & Avocado Chirashi
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Spicy Tuna & Avocado Chirashi a try. One serving contains 701 calories, 30g of protein, and 43g of fat. This recipe serves 2. For $1.76 per serving, this recipe covers 32% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. If you have sriracha sauce, basic mayonnaise, very sushi grade tuna, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the avocado you could follow this main course with the chocolate avocado mousse | quick dark chocolate avocado mousse as a dessert. 10 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 88%, this dish is super. Similar recipes include Spicy Tuna Poke and Avocado Wonton Cups, Spicy Tunan and Avocado Cucumber Sushi Bites, and Soy tuna tacos with lime and spicy avocado cream.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are great choices for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Provenance Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 34 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Provenance Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot
productMatches.description:
Our 2006 Merlot isn't shy, with its deep, dark garnet hue and abounding aromas of rich black
cherry, cassis and clove. Approachable, integrated tannins frame the generous dark fruit
flavors and coat the palate with soft velvet. The long, fruity finish, laced with autumn spices,
ends with a lively cranberry zing. "This is a very classy wine from a gorgeous vintage. Take
that, Miles!" laughs Winemaker Tom Rinaldi, with a reference to the film Sideways.
